text: hi guys it's angel today I have a very
special recipe for you I've partnered up
with Pearl River Bridge brand of Asian
sauces to show you guys how to make a
delicious five-spice roasted soy chicken
now when I normally think of chicken I
always get a bit worried that it's going
to turn out dry but in this recipe we
are going to be brining the chicken in a
sweet soy sauce mixture then finishing
it off with a delicious and very
aromatic five spice rub right before
cooking it is going to be one of the
most flavorful and moist
roasted chicken that you've had so with
that let's get started for the
ingredients let's start by making the
brine I'm starting with a 5 pound
chicken which I've rinsed and cleaned
earlier and when you're rinsing the
chicken just double check to see if the
skin needs to be exfoliated and if it
does just exfoliate the chicken with
some kosher salt if needed this will
help make the skin smoother afterward
place your chicken into a large stockpot
I'm using an 8 quart stockpot here and
then start adding the other ingredients
for the brine we'll need 1/2 a cup of
Pearl River Bridge superior light soy
sauce this will give it a nice sweet
flavor we will also need a quarter cup
of Pearl River Bridge mushroom flavored
superior dark soy sauce now this sauce
has mushroom extract in it which will
give the chicken a nice depth and flavor
and because it is a dark soy sauce it'll
also give the chicken skin a nice brown
color next we'll add our brown sugar
it's just 1/2 a cup of brown sugar
dissolved in half a cup of hot water
then allow to cool to room temperature
before using add all those ingredients
to our stock pot along with 10 cups of
filtered water to make our brine now all
we have to do is
cover and let this brine in the fridge
for three to four hours after three to
four hours discard the brine and place
the chicken on a rack in the sink and
prepare a pot of hot boiling water we're
going to blanch the chicken with the hot
water to clean and tighten the skin feel
free to use a spoon to ladle the water
if that's easier and make sure to blanch
the entire chicken once you're done
rinse the chicken under cold water until
the skin is cool to the touch
after that Pat the chicken dry with
paper towels and place on top of the jar
so it's sitting upright we want to make
sure that the skin is completely dry so
it's crispier when cooking now you have
the option to let it air dry overnight
in your fridge for an extra crispy skin
or you can skip this step if you're in a
hurry after the chicken has had a chance
to dry the skin should look shiny and
smooth now we're ready to cook I've got
my oven preheated to 425 degrees then
right before cooking I'm going to use a
small amount of oil in a dish and using
my fingers dab and rub just a very light
coating on the skin to help it brown
next I'm going to prepare a five-spice
rub this is just a mixture of 1
tablespoon five-spice powder and half a
teaspoon of salt then generously
sprinkle and rub the five-spice mix all
over the chicken
finally cut up a small piece of ginger
and place the pieces inside the chicken
cavity before cooking
we're going to let the chicken cook in a
roasting pan for 15 minutes at 425
degrees then drop the temperature to 400
degrees and continue to cook for another
45 minutes or until done this should be
a total cook time of around 1 hour
now not all ovens cook the same so it's
best to use a thermometer if you have
one once it's done remove the chicken
and let it rest for 10 to 15 minutes
before cutting and serving this will
allow for some carryover cooking time
and so the juices have a chance to
redistribute
so that's how easy it is to make my
five-spice roasted soy chicken as you
can see the brine was super easy we have
the two sauces that we added along with
a little bit of brown sugar and the cook
time for roasting the chicken was just
about an hour so it's definitely
something that you can prepare in
advance the day before and cook off for
a weeknight meal or if you like you
could dress this up for the holidays and
serve this with my pumpkin fried rice
recipe and maybe even some garlic stir
fried string beans now I love the smell
of this chicken and how my kitchen
smells right now so I am just going to
dig in and try a little piece
mmm the chicken was so flavorful so
moist I love the subtle flavors of the
soy and then there's that five-spice
powder it's perfectly seasoned and
perfectly roasted I hope you guys
enjoyed this video thank you guys so
much for watching don't forget to Like
and subscribe to my channel angel Wong's
kitchen for more authentic Asian recipes
made simple and fun I'll see you guys
soon bye
you
